document.discussion_title: Michael Kors Holdings’ (KORS) Buy Rating Reiterated at Jefferies Group
document.topic_text: Tweet Michael Kors Holdings Ltd (NASDAQ:KORS) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by equities researchers at Jefferies Group in a research note issued to investors on Monday, Market Beat reports. Other large investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Accident Compensation Corp purchased a new stake in Michael Kors Holdings during the fourth quarter worth approximately $2,155,000. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC increased its stake in Michael Kors Holdings by 44.9% in the fourth quarter. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC now owns 35,727 shares of the lifestyle brand’s stock worth $1,432,000 after buying an additional 11,079 shares in the last quarter. Janus Capital Management boosted its stake in shares of Michael Kors Holdings by 10.0% in the third quarter. Janus Capital Management now owns 103,504 shares of the lifestyle brand’s stock valued at $4,372,000 after buying an additional 9,369 shares during the last quarter. ProShare Advisors LLC boosted its stake in shares of Michael Kors Holdings by 1.9% in the fourth quarter. ProShare Advisors LLC now owns 56,066 shares of the lifestyle brand’s stock valued at $2,246,000 after buying an additional 1,046 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Dimensional Fund Advisors LP boosted its stake in shares of Michael Kors Holdings by 7.7% in the fourth quarter. Dimensional Fund Advisors LP now owns 484,465 shares of the lifestyle brand’s stock valued at $19,408,000 after buying an additional 34,496 shares during the last quarter. A number of other equities analysts have also issued reports on KORS. Piper Jaffray reaffirmed a “neutral” rating and set a $38.00 target price on shares of Michael Kors Holdings in a research report on Monday, February 1st. Telsey Advisory Group boosted their target price on shares of Michael Kors Holdings from $46.00 to $55.00 and gave the stock a “market perform” rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 3rd. Deutsche Bank reaffirmed a “buy” rating on shares of Michael Kors Holdings in a research report on Tuesday, April 12th. RBC Capital reaffirmed a “hold” rating and set a $52.00 target price (up previously from $48.00) on shares of Michael Kors Holdings in a research report on Wednesday, February 3rd. Finally, Robert W. Baird boosted their target price on shares of Michael Kors Holdings from $42.00 to $52.00 and gave the stock a “neutral” rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 3rd. Twenty-three analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company. Michael Kors Holdings currently has an average rating of “Hold” and an average target price of $55.00. Shares of Michael Kors Holdings ( NASDAQ:KORS ) traded up 0.37% during trading on Monday, hitting $51.79. 1,406,681 shares of the company were exchanged. The stock has a market cap of $9.27 billion and a P/E ratio of 11.94. The company’s 50-day moving average price is $55.21 and its 200 day moving average price is $46.17. Michael Kors Holdings has a 12 month low of $34.83 and a 12 month high of $63.95. Michael Kors Holdings (NASDAQ:KORS) last announced its earnings results on Tuesday, February 2nd. The lifestyle brand reported $1.59 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $1.46 by $0.13. During the same period last year, the firm posted $1.48 EPS. The company had revenue of $1.34 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.36 billion. The company’s revenue was up 6.3% compared to the same quarter last year. On average, equities analysts predict that Michael Kors Holdings will post $4.43 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Michael Kors Holdings Limited is a global accessories, footwear and apparel company. The Company operates its business in three segments: retail, wholesale and licensing. It offers two primary collections: the Michael Kors luxury collection and the MICHAEL Michael Kors accessible luxury collection. In the Michael Kors collection, it offers accessories, including handbags and small leather goods, many of which are made from leathers and other exotic skins, footwear and apparel, including ready-to-wear women swear and menswear. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/michael-kors-holdings-kors-buy-rating-reiterated-at-jefferies-group/ Michael Kors Holdings Ltd Michael Kors Holdings Ltd
